get.summary: Returns the list of available Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) for a particular host, as specified by its Hardware Support Manager (HSM)

parameters.name: manager
parameters.description: Identifier for the Hardware Support Manager (HSM).

parameters.name: base_image_version
parameters.description: vSphere release version the Hardware Support Package (HSP) must support to match the filter. Only Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) compatible with the vSphere release version specified in 'baseImageVersion' will be returned. The 'baseImageVersion' parameter should be a full numeric base image version string (e.g. "7.1.0-2.3.436234"). Future implementations may support version specification by prefix (e.g. "7.1" to specify all updates and builds of 7.1) or other forms of specification (e.g. ">=7.0"). Hardware Support Pacakges (HSPs) may be advertised as supporting truncated version strings to indicate the remainder is wildcarded. Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-1.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". Note that we require compatible base image versions be specified at least down to the update version (i.e. "7.0" is insufficiently constrained)

200.description: List of available Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) for given manager

500.description: If there is some unknown internal error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.

404.description: If there is no Hardware Support Manager (HSM) with the specified name

503.description: If the service is not available.

Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-2.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". EsxHclCompatibilityStatus.description: The {@name CompatibilityStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines compatibility status of a given server or PCI device against a specific release of ESXi.

vendor.description: The vendor that produced the driver.
The vendor that produced the firmware.

The current release of the ESXi, which also can be checked for compatibility.

The information for the release does not include patch information.

bios.description: The BIOS information about the constraint.

notes.description: Any information that should be taken into account when reviewing the BIOS constraint.

EsxHclHostsCompatibilityReportCreateTask.description: Specifies the input parameters for generating compatibility report.

driver.description: The driver information about the constraint.

firmware.description: The firmware information about the constraint.

notes.description: Any information that should be taken into account when reviewing the device constraint.

compatibility.description: Indicates compatibility status of the PCI device.

supported_releases.description: Provides information about supported releases for this device.

vcg_link.description: Provides link to the VMware Compatibility Guide for further information on the compatibility.

notes.description: Information that needs to be taken into account when considering this device hcl.

host.description: FQDN identifying the ESXi host that the report refers to.

target_release.description: Indicates for which ESXi release the report is generated.

server_hcl.description: Lists compatibility information for the ESXi's server part.

devices_hcl.description: Lists compatibility information for discoverable PCI devices of the host.

generated_at.description: Specifies the time the report was generated.

identifier.description:
The identifier of the compatibility report.

{@link esx.hcl.Reports#get} provides location where a file based report based on the {@name HclReport} can be downloaded using this identifier.

bios_constraints.description: Lists the BIOS constraints that the target ESXi release has for this server.

supported_releases.description: Provides information about supported releases for this entry.

vcg_link.description: Provides link to the VMware Compatibility Guide for further information on the compatibility.

notes.description: Information that needs to be taken into account when considering this server hardware compatibility.

matches.description:
Provides information about possible compatibility matches for the given server.

There could be multiple matches returned as there are several possible matches in the Compatibility data.

manager.description: Name of the Hardware Support Manager (HSM) (e.g. "Frobozz Hardware Support Manager")

description.description: User-intelligible description of the HSM (e.g. "Front end for Frobozz so-and-so management system")

display_name.description: UI label for HSM, derived from HSM extension's description's 'label' field. (e.g. "Frobozz Free Management System")

vendor.description: Company providing the Hardware Support Manager (HSM) (e.g. "Frobozz Magic Software Company")

base_image_version.description: vSphere release version the Hardware Support Package (HSP) must support to match the filter. Only Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) compatible with the vSphere release version specified in 'baseImageVersion' will be returned. The 'baseImageVersion' parameter should be a full numeric base image version string (e.g. "7.1.0-2.3.436234"). Future implementations may support version specification by prefix (e.g. "7.1" to specify all updates and builds of 7.1) or other forms of specification (e.g. ">=7.0"). Hardware Support Pacakges (HSPs) may be advertised as supporting truncated version strings to indicate the remainder is wildcarded. Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-1.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". Note that we require compatible base image versions be specified at least down to the update version (i.e. "7.0" is insufficiently constrained)

pkg.description: Name of the Hardware Support Package (e.g. "Jan. 2018 Release" or "Latest Hardware Support Package for Frobozz GenX hardware") selected

version.description: Version of the Hardware Support Package (e.g. "20180128.1" or "v42") selected

description.description: Description of the Hardware Support Package (HSP) (e.g. for use in help bubble)

display_version.description: Human readable version of the HSP manifest.

base_image_version.description: vSphere release version for the component information in the Hardware Support Package (HSP). Only Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) compatible with the vSphere release version specified in 'baseImageVersion' will be returned. The 'baseImageVersion' parameter should be a full numeric base image version string (e.g. "7.1.0-2.3.436234"). Future implementations may support version specification by prefix (e.g. "7.1" to specify all updates and builds of 7.1) or other forms of specification (e.g. ">=7.0"). Hardware Support Pacakges (HSPs) may be advertised as supporting truncated version strings to indicate the remainder is wildcarded. Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-2.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". Note that we require compatible base image versions be specified at least down to the update version (i.e. "7.0" is insufficiently constrained)

pkg.description: Name of the Hardware Support Package (e.g. "Jan. 2018 Release" or "Latest Hardware Support Package for Frobozz GenX hardware") selected

version.description: Version of the Hardware Support Package (e.g. "20180128.1" or "v42") selected

description.description: Description of the Hardware Support Package (HSP) (e.g. for use in help bubble)

components.description: List of components in this HSP manifest.

removed_components.description: List of components removed by this HSP manifest.

status.description: Compliance status of the Hardware Support Package (HSP).

current.description: Current version of the Hardware Support Package present on the host.

target.description: Target version of the Hardware Support Package present in the software specification.

hardware_modules.description: Compliance result for individual hardware module on the host. The key is the module identifier and value is the HardwareModuleFirmwareCompliance for the device. NOTE: if no individual hardware module compliance is returned by the, Hardware Support Manager (HSM), this map may have no entries even if ComplianceStatus = NON_COMPLIANT

pkg.description: Identifier of Hardware Support Package (HSP) selected

version.description: Version of the Hardware Support Package (HSP) selected (e.g. "20180128.1" or "v42")
Version of the Hardware Support Package (HSP) selected (e.g. "20180128.1" or "v42")

packages.description: Map of Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) for the cluster.  The key is the Hardware Support Manager (HSM) name and the value is the specification detailing the HSP configured for that HSM.

status.description: Overall compliance state of the host.

notifications.description: Notifications returned by the scan operation.

commit.description: Identifier of the commit on which the scan is run to generate this result.

base_image.description: Compliance result for the base image.

add_on.description: Compliance result for the OEM add-on.

hardware_support.description: Compliance result for hardware support (both Hardware Support Package or HSP and individual hardware module firmware) for every HSP configured, keyed by Hardware Support Manager (HSM).

components.description: Compliance result for all the effective components and all the components present on the host. The key is the component name and value is the ComponentCompliance.

solutions.description: Compliance result for solutions. The key is the solution name and value is the SolutionCompliance.

time.description: The time the notification was raised/found.

EsxSettingsNotificationType.description: The (@name Type} {@term enumerated type} contains the possible different types of notification.

add_on.description: OEM customization on top of given base-image. The components in this customization override the components in the base base-image.

components.description: Information about the components in the software specification.

solutions.description: Information about the solutions in the software specification.

hardware_support.description: Information about the Hardware Support Packages (HSP) configured.

current.description: Current solution present on the host.

target.description: Target solution present in the software specification.

display_version.description: Human readable version of the component.

components.description: Components registered by the solution. If the component is not present in the depot, then corresponding details are absent from the list.

details.description: Details about the solution from the depot.

messages.description:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

data.description:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

challenge.description:
Indicates the authentication challenges applicable to the target API provider. It can be used by a client to discover the correct authentication scheme to use. The exact syntax of the value is defined by the specific provider, the protocol and authentication schemes used.

For example, a provider using REST may adhere to the WWW-Authenticate HTTP header specification, RFC7235, section 4.1. In this case an example challenge value may be: SIGN realm="27da1358-2ba4-11e9-b210-d663bd873d93",sts="http://vcenter/sso?vsphere.local", Basic realm="vCenter"

id.description:
Unique identifier of the localizable string or message template.

This identifier is typically used to retrieve a locale-specific string or message template from a message catalog.

default_message.description: The value of this localizable string or message template in the {@code en_US} (English) locale.  If {@link #id} refers to a message template, the default message will contain the substituted arguments. This value can be used by clients that do not need to display strings and messages in the native language of the user.  It could also be used as a fallback if a client is unable to access the appropriate message catalog.

args.description: Positional arguments to be substituted into the message template. This list will be empty if the message uses named arguments or has no arguments.

params.description: Named arguments to be substituted into the message template.

localized.description: Localized string value as per request requirements.

s.description: {@term String} value associated with the parameter.

dt.description: Date and time value associated with the parameter. Use the {@name #format} {@term field} to specify date and time display style.

i.description: {@term long} value associated with the parameter.

d.description: The {@term double} value associated with the parameter. The number of displayed fractional digits is changed via {@name #precision} {@term field}.

l.description: Nested localizable value associated with the parameter. This is useful construct to convert to human readable localized form {@term enumerated type} and {@term boolean} values. It can also be used for proper handling of pluralization and gender forms in localization. Recursive {@name NestedLocalizableMessage} instances can be used for localizing short lists of items.

format.description: Format associated with the date and time value in {@name #dt} {@term field}. The {@term enumeration value} {@code SHORT_DATETIME} will be used as default.

precision.description: Number of fractional digits to include in formatted {@term double} value.

VapiStdLocalizationParamDateTimeFormat.description: The {@name DateTimeFormat} {@term enumerated type} lists possible date and time formatting options. It combines the Unicode CLDR format types - full, long, medium and short with 3 different presentations - date only, time only and combined date and time presentation.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the localizable string or message template.

This identifier is typically used to retrieve a locale-specific string or message template from a message catalog.

params.description: Named Arguments to be substituted into the message template.
